question.title: Sort a Stack
question.content:
Given a stack, sort the elements inside that stack in ascending order using only push and pop operation. You can use one additional stack only.

For eg. 

Input Stack :  5 (top)
               4
               3
               2
               1
Output Stack : 1 (top)
               2
               3
               4
               5
Input format
First line of input consists of an integer representing the size of the stack, N
Second line of input consistes of N space-separated integers representing the elements of the stack
Output format
The only line of output consists of the elements of the stack in sorted order (space-separated)
Constraints
0 <= N <= 1000
Time limit: 1 sec
Sample Input
5
1 2 3 4 5
Sample Output
1 2 3 4 5

rephrased.body: Sort the elements of a given stack in ascending order using only push and pop operations. You are allowed to use one additional stack for temporary storage. The stack is represented such that the top element is the most recently added element.
constraints: 0 <= N <= 1000, where N is the number of elements in the stack

testcases.explanation: The input stack is already sorted in ascending order, so the output is the same as the input.
The input stack is in descending order. The algorithm should reverse the stack to produce ascending order.
